group_1.textLeft: Here, stir-fried thick tofu and bean sprouts@with ponzu sauce, and here...
Bean sprout soup and marinated bean sprouts.@And then, this batch of bean sprouts is...
Well, there were a lot of those.
They wilt quickly, so we should eat them soon.

group_1.textRight: Haha...@Sena, seems like you like bean sprouts.

group_1.textLeft: No, not really.@If anything, I dislike them.

group_1.textRight: Well... Sena, you're great at cooking food.@I can't do that.

group_1.textLeft: I'll continue to cook for you!
For lunch, I'll add some noodles to the leftover@bean sprout soup.
Oh, maybe...is it not enough?@Should I increase the amount for you?
Hmm... If only I could earn money...
Then, I could treat you with delicious food.

group_1.textRight: That's not necessary.@Resting now is important.
When the food here runs out,@we can take over the neighboring house.

group_1.narration: But still...@I want Hanna to have fun.@I want her to think it's good to be with me.
...Thinking that way,@when I found a shop that looked nice,@I tried asking if I could work there,@as I had done in the towns we'd visited.
The answer was always that they need@permission from a parent.

group_1.textCenter: (...If they say that, there's no choice@but to give up...)

group_1.narration: It's already getting dark around here.@I couldn't find that pen either.@Nothing's going well.

group_1.textCenter: ...That pen...the matching one I gave@Hanna a long time ago...
Why am I...searching for it now?
...Ah, that's right...@Because I'll give it as a Christmas present.
Haha... I've really been forgetful lately.@I wonder why...

group_1.narration: I know why my memory is fading, actually,@but I lack the courage to face it,@so I pretend that I don't know.
Peering inside, I held my breath.@It resembled the cafe Hanna and I used to frequent.
First a place resembling the apartment complex@I lived in, and now a place resembling the cafe@we often visited.@What is happening...is like memories are@clinging to me, making me uncomfortable.
If I hadn't become a Magical Girl...@if I had worked at that cafe,@what would have happened...?
My father...That man is not here, but if I had@put the money I earned into the house,@I could have made things easier for my mother.
And who knows, maybe...@The kind Hanna would have still figured out@what's going on and took that man down.
Since it seems she'd been going to that cafe@even before meeting me, we could've met@without me becoming a Magical Girl.
And we would have surely gotten along.
Even if the beginning was different,@no matter what...@Hanna and I would have become close.@I believe that's our destiny.
I would get happy seeing Hanna coming as a customer,@talking a lot, getting scolded by the master...@but I would have loved that time so much...

group_1.textCenter: And then, there was my mother at home,@saying that as long as she had me,
she was fine without that man.
At least, that's what she would have said...
And at school, we'd hang out after class@without worrying about money...
Eating crepes...[chara:114403:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:114403:lipSynch_1][chara:114403:cheek_0][chara:114403:face_mtn_ex_030.exp3.json]not having to hide my poverty...

group_1.narration: ...Maybe that's how I would live the normal life@I've always dreamed of...

group_1.textCenter: After all this time, a normal life is...
